title: [AMQ-8096] Upgrade to Apache Karaf 4.2.10 and improve features XML
[AMQ-8090] Add a release validation script
body:
A release validation script

1. Pass maven repo as arg 1
2. Select version to validate

Preforms following tasks:

- Download artifact
- Download sha1 and md5 sum
- Validate sha1 and md5 sums
- Extract artifact
- Delete and cleanup

title: [AMQ-8045] Use the file: protocol in jetty.xml
Improve ActiveMQ feature to avoid mistake to use Spring 5
[AMQ-8068] Fix topic memory leak on message eviction using UniquePropertyMessageEvictionStrategy
Adding an option which allows messages to expire on active durable subscriptions
body:
When an *active* durable subscription fails to acknowledge messages due to being offline/unreliable/misbehaved, messages which expire according to their TTL are not marked expired on that subscription. This can lead to an unbounded number of messages building up in the message store, eventually exhausting quotas and causing backpressure. This PR introduces a new broker-level setting `enableMessageExpirationOnActiveDurableSubs` which allows messages to expire on *active* durable subscriptions.

We have been running with this setting enabled in quite a few production environments for a couple of years with no observed ill effects. Even so, the new setting is disabled by default to ensure backward compatibility. This is my first attempt to submit a PR to this repo, so please let me know if I need to provide additional information. 

I did not attempt to create a new JIRA issue as there are at least two issues out there already which appear to be related:
AMQ-6636
AMQ-7212

title: Change ActiveMQTextMessage to become serializable
body:
There is a business use case which need to persist ActiveMQTextMessage (or TextMessage) into database. Required ActiveMQTextMessage to become serializable. 
TextMessage implementation by both IBM Websphere and Weblogic are serializable. 
https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/SSFKSJ_7.5.0/com.ibm.mq.javadoc.doc/WMQJMSClasses/com/ibm/jms/JMSMessage.html
https://docs.oracle.com/middleware/12213/wls/WLAPI/weblogic/jms/common/TextMessageImpl.html

title: AMQ-8009 - Spring upgrade required for Karaf feature
ActiveMQ 5.15.9 includes two vulnerable jar
body:
Hi We found some problems when using ActiveMQ
The ActiveMQ 5.15.9 includes geronimo-j2ee-management_1.1_spec.jar and geronimo-jms_1.1_spec.jar

These two jars have serious vulnerabilities
The vulnerability information is as follows
https://rnd-vulncenter.huawei.com/vuln/toViewOfficialDetail?cveId=CVE-2011-5034
https://rnd-vulncenter.huawei.com/vuln/toViewOfficialDetail?cveId=CVE-2013-1777

Can subsequent versions of ActiveMQ fix this problem

Shebang in env
body:
This patch removes the shebang from the env file. The file is  and
should always be  sourced and never be executed directly and should
thus not contain a shebang.

The file has also already no executable flag. Probably for the same
reason.

title: AMQ-7458 - Implement bounds checking on the message scheduling proper
body:
ties

This task is to implement bounds checking on the message scheduling properties. The values for delay, period  + repeat should be rejected if they are < 0. Also, a maximum value should be set (and configurable) for the max repeat value, as it has the potential to cause a denial of service issue if many messages are sent with a repeat value of Integer.MAX_VALUE. In the accompanying PR, I've set the default max value to 1000.

title: AMQ-7439: AbstractMQTTSocket#getProtocolConverter: Race condition in
body:
double-checked locking object initialization

`protocolConverter` may be visible to other threads before its properties are set.

title: AMQ-7438 - Harden deserialization
body: The PR hardens the deserialization process by enforcing that only classes of packages that start with java.lang/java.util/org.apache.activemq are deserialized. The ObjectMarshaller.java is deleted, as it's not used anywhere.
